resources.string: Understand the legal status of marijuana in your jurisdiction.\nBe aware of the amount you are legally allowed to carry.\nKnow the difference between medical and recreational possession where applicable.

Carry it in a closed, non-accessible container when traveling.\nHave your medical marijuana card with you if you are a registered patient.\nBe aware of the areas where possession is illegal (e.g., federal lands, schools, certain public places).
Do not use marijuana in public places unless explicitly allowed by local law.\nAvoid driving or operating heavy machinery after using marijuana.
Always have your documentation ready if youâ€™re a medical user.\nBe familiar with your rights to use, possess, and possibly grow marijuana for medical purposes.

If stopped by police, be polite and respectful.\nYou are not required to consent to a search unless the officer has a warrant or probable cause.\nKnow your rights but also understand the potential consequences of asserting those rights (See "Legislation and Rights" below).

Stay calm and do not resist.\nYou have the right to remain silent and the right to an attorney.\nDo not provide any details or admit to anything regarding your marijuana use or possession until you have legal representation.
